author: butek
msg: Programmatic use of the emitter (like Wsdl2javaAntTask) should use WSDL2Java,
not Emitter, so I've added the option accessors that are on Emitter to WSDL2Java.

author: dug
msg: Java has a bit of an "issue" in that you can ask for
(Element[]).class but you can't ask a ClassLoader to
actually load that class - so you can't dynamically invoke
a method with Element[] as one of its parameters when the
array of Class's is supposed to have been loaded from a particular
classloader (or at least I couldn't figure out how to do it).
So switched everything from Element[] to Vector, and added
a test for it.

author: dug
msg: Opps - remove an extra println

author: dug
msg: Change how we invoke message services.  Continue to support the old
parameters (Doc or MsgContext+Doc) but make the ones we look for
first be;  Element[] and then MsgContext+Element[].
Switching this to an array of Elements for 2 reasons:
1 - match how things work on the client.  The client passes in to
invoke() an array of BodyElements, so the server should match.
2 - in Soap 1.2 *the* Body is viewed as a single computational unit,
how the service decides to deal with it is up to it.  So the
SOAP engine should just pass on the body and let the service decide
what to do with it.  If they want to *just* deal with the 1st body
element (and treat the others as additional info) then they can just
use the [0]'th element.
I don't believe this change impacts our support of the 1.1 spec.

author: dug
msg: Get the build working again.
The fix in test/wsdl/Wsdl2javaAntTask.java is wrong (I think) but
it aleast runs.  *SOMEONE* please put in the correct fix and
of course run "ant clean all" *before* you commit.  :-)
